content: Post-operative discomfort and swelling, that may necessitate several days of home recuperation.
Heavy bleeding that may be prolonged.

Injury to the adjacent teeth and fillings, causing the loss of a tooth or teeth or need for
          restorations or root canal therapy.
Development of a dry socket - localized alveolitis - requiring extended treatment.
Stretching of the corners of the mouth with resultant cracking and bruising.

Injury to the nerve underlying the teeth resulting in numbness, tingling, painful or altered sensation in the lip,
          chin, cheek, gum, teeth, and/or tongue on the operated side; this may persist for several weeks, months, or in remote instances, permanently.
Changes in the bite or pain of the Temporomandibular joint (ear/jaw joint).
